intro: Nesaea erecta f. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy nesaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy foliage, which gives it its specific epithet "hirtella." The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
